posts.name: That one Wisconsin Pit design fanatic
posts.cooked:
Howdy! I have been looking at double powering an OpenMesh radio (because redundancy calms the nerves of our electrical team) for quite some time and I’m fairly familiar with the rules for using dual power, but one thing I am not sure of is if powering a radio with a REV mini power module is possible or not. The Radio only draws a maximum of 1.5A, but when a VRM is used to power it, it takes the 12V 2A port(s) which makes me think that a MPM should be a viable option to power it with a POE injector cable and barrel jack (since the power is coming from the same source it should still be legal). I’m still a bit unsure and weary of the idea since I haven’t had any experience or confirmation of the idea, but if we don’t have to put a VRM on our robot just for dual power I’d rather not.

If anyone has any expertise regarding this it would be greatly appreciated! Thank you!
posts.display_username: That one Wisconsin Pit design fanatic

posts.name: EricH
posts.cooked:
There’s a difference between possible and legal .

Please check your proposed idea against R617 , as it restricts where on the power distribution the radio’s regulated power can be plugged in.

posts.name: That one Wisconsin Pit design fanatic
posts.cooked: First off- Thank you for the info! Secondly- I looked through the rule and one thing I noticed was that it stated that power off of the 20, 21, and 22 ports with a 10A breaker is legal as long as that you only use those ports so (from my understanding of the rule) you could dual power from two of those ports or have a MPM take the output of one of those ports and then dual power from those ports. If you have any other input or could help me understand the rule a little more fully I would greatly appreciate it. Thank you!
posts.display_username: That one Wisconsin Pit design fanatic

posts.name: EricH
posts.cooked:
This is going to be a bit of a complicated answer.

Your options for radio power are VRM or RPM , either-or. This is then connected to the PDH ( one terminal of the 3) or the PDP (designated spot).

VRM allows dual power via using one port set for barrel jack and one port set for POE passive conductor.

RPM requires POE only, effectively.

It sounds like what you’re wanting to do is: PDH , power to MPM, use MPM to split power to 1x barrel jack and 1x RPM /passive conductor. To that I say: You do realize there are other connectors, right? You could splice the power cable so it becomes a Y-cable, as long as you use proper connectors. No MPM needed… I think. See the Q&A comment below.

That said: I think we need to bring in some experts in. @Jon_Stratis might have some comments from an LRI point of view. And there might be a good Q&A question in “does R625 apply to connectors that might be used per R623 to add an extra wire path for power redundancy?” or similar phrasing.

reply_to_user.name: That one Wisconsin Pit design fanatic

posts.name: Jon Stratis
posts.cooked:
R616 , you are using either a VRM or a RPM to power the radio, there are no other options.  I don’t believe the Mini Power Module will give you regulated voltage, which will result in your radio dropping out without either a VRM or an RPM to provide that.

If your goal is to do both POE and barrel connector, then you need to use the VRM .  Personally, I find the RPM to be very reliable, and I haven’t seen robots drop out using it (without a barrel connector for redundancy).  Keep in mind the key with POE - if your Ethernet cable is loose enough to drop power, then you’re most likely also dropping data.  Use a good quality cable, ensure is snaps in properly, and you’ll never have a problem!

posts.name: Allen Nuttle
posts.cooked: Legal Options for Wiring your Robot Radio in 2022 General Forum

link_counts.title: Legal Options for Wiring your Robot Radio in 2022

posts.name: Joshua J
posts.cooked:
Domm:

but when a VRM is used to power it, it takes the 12V 2A port(s) which makes me think that a MPM should be a viable option to power it with a POE injector cable and barrel jack (since the power is coming from the same source it should still be legal).

That source isn’t legal in the first place, dual power or not. You can’t go straight from the MPM to the radio via either barrel jack or passive POE injector because the power is unregulated battery voltage.

There are two legal power regulators for the radio: the VRM , which can legally be used to provide redundant connections through the two 12V 2A ports, and the RPM , which provides 18V out through the Ethernet port and can’t be mixed with anything else due to the voltage difference.

The legality of an MPM inserted in between a VRM or RPM is unclear, but there’s no advantage to doing so.
